title: Halloween 2019: The spookiest and most hilarious celebrity costumes
text:
Halloween 2019: The spookiest and most hilarious celebrity costumes originally appeared on goodmorningamerica.com

Halloween Night hasn’t even rolled by yet, but that hasn’t stopped your favorite celebrities from getting their spook on, Hollyweird style.

This weekend, stars everywhere celebrated the fall’s most haunted holiday, and their costumes did not disappoint. Some donned daring outfits, dripping with blood and gore, while others paid homage to icons and went as their fellow celebrities.

Whatever the inspiration, you’re in for a treat with these Halloween 2019 looks.

Demi Lovato

The singer graced us with not one but two gorgeous costumes this weekend. First, we almost lost our heads at her Marie Antoinette-inspired look, and then we lost our minds at her transformation into Pennywise the clown from "It."

Tracee Ellis Ross and the "Black-ish" cast

Ross and her cast family dressed up as the "Tethered" from Jordan Peele's hit horror movie "Us." This creepy costume has been dominating the pop culture-inspired Halloween scene this year.

Ashley Graham

The model stunned in a skin-tight red latex dress as Jessica Rabbit. Graham, who announced her pregnancy in August, showed off her growing bump and vamped for the camera, doing her impression of the cartoon character's classic line, "I'm not bad. I'm just drawn that way."

Kate Beckinsale

The internet did a double take when Beckinsale, dressed as Holly Golightly from "Breakfast at Tiffany's," strutted down the aisle of a grocery store on Instagram.

Nina Dobrev

You didn't know she was the bad guy? Dobrev killed at the Casamigos Halloween party with her Billie Eilish costume. If that wasn't enough, she later posted a picture dressed as Marie S'Infiltre, the French comedian and Youtuber who crashed the Chanel runway in September. Dobrev hilariously reenacted the incident with a friend dressed as Gigi Hadid, who escorted the comedian crasher off the stage.

Lisa Rinna

It's two queens colliding. The "Real Housewives of Beverly Hills" star paid homage to Jennifer Lopez's iconic green dress from the 2000 Grammys. Suffice to say, the internet is flipping.

(MORE: Dad builds mini-Millennium Falcon for epic trick-or-treating this Halloween)

Missy Elliott

Elliott transported us back in time for her Halloween costume as she recreated her first album, "Supa Dupa Fly," from over 22 years ago. Honestly, we can't tell the difference.

Cardi B

The rapper and songwriter went old school with her red-and-white nurse costume this year.

Gabrielle Union-Wade

Here comes the nostalgia because Union-Wade brought back her beloved "Bring It On" character to celebrate Halloween. The actress, whose birthday is Oct. 29, twinned with her 11-month-old daughter Kaavia, who also dressed up as the classic cheerleader.

Stormi Webster

Kylie Jenner posted two photos of her daughter Stormi sporting the same look Jenner wore to the Met Gala last May.

Jessica Biel and Justin Timberlake

Jessica Biel dressed up as husband Justin Timberlake for Halloween, and social media can't handle it. After an old video emerged of Biel admitting she was "not a huge fan" of NSYNC, the actress used her Halloween costume to make it up to him. Keeping with the theme, Timberlake complemented his wife's costume by dressing up as a microphone.

Kourtney Kardashian

Although Kardashian captioned her Instagram photo showing off her Ariana Grande costume with "No tears left to cry," we guarantee you we only shed happy tears when seeing the star's uncanny likeness to the powerhouse singer.

Halsey

With one of the spookiest costumes on our list, Halsey killed Halloween with her Marilyn Manson costume.
